radiographic_examinations.findings: The appendix is dilated to 18 mm and contains two fecaliths, one of which is obstructive closer to the base. There is subtle fascial thickening and mild surrounding fat stranding. The lung bases are clear, and there are no focal liver lesions, hydronephrosis, or masses. The colon shows scattered diverticula without evidence of diverticulitis. No pelvic lymphadenopathy or free fluid noted.
